balanced.use_case: Balanced mode - good sensitivity with reasonable specificity

URGENT.name: Urgent Specialist Referral
URGENT.description: Suspicious for skin cancer. Requires urgent dermatology evaluation and possible biopsy.

PRIORITY.name: Priority Referral
PRIORITY.description: Needs dermatology evaluation. May require treatment or monitoring.

ROUTINE.name: Routine Evaluation
ROUTINE.description: Non-urgent but may benefit from dermatology consultation or primary care treatment.

MONITOR.name: Self-Monitor
MONITOR.description: Likely benign. Continue monitoring for changes using ABCDE criteria.

Melanoma.action: Seek urgent dermatology referral for dermoscopy and possible biopsy
Melanoma.warning: Melanoma can be life-threatening if not caught early. Any suspicion warrants evaluation.
Melanoma.clinical_priority: CRITICAL - missed melanoma can be fatal

Squamous Cell Carcinoma.action: Refer to dermatology within 2 weeks for evaluation
Squamous Cell Carcinoma.warning: SCC can metastasize if untreated. Early treatment has excellent outcomes.
Squamous Cell Carcinoma.clinical_priority: HIGH - delayed treatment increases metastatic risk

Basal Cell Carcinoma.warning: BCC rarely metastasizes but grows locally and can cause tissue damage.
Basal Cell Carcinoma.clinical_priority: MODERATE - delayed treatment may require larger excision

Actinic Keratosis.action: Dermatology evaluation recommended. May be treated with cryotherapy or topicals.
Actinic Keratosis.warning: Pre-cancerous lesion. ~10% progress to SCC if untreated.

Non-Neoplastic.action: May benefit from primary care or dermatology treatment
Non-Neoplastic.warning: Includes inflammatory conditions (eczema, psoriasis, dermatitis), infections (fungal, bacterial). Not cancer but often needs treatment for symptom relief.
Non-Neoplastic.clinical_priority: LOW - conditions are treatable, not life-threatening

Melanocytic Nevus.action: Continue routine self-monitoring using ABCDE criteria
Melanocytic Nevus.warning: Common moles. Monitor for asymmetry, border irregularity, color changes, diameter >6mm, or evolution.

Seborrheic Keratosis.action: Benign growth. No treatment needed unless cosmetically bothersome.
Seborrheic Keratosis.warning: Very common in older adults. Can sometimes mimic melanoma to untrained eye.

Dermatofibroma.action: Benign fibrous growth. No treatment needed.
Dermatofibroma.warning: Firm nodule, often on legs. May persist indefinitely.

Vascular Lesion.action: Benign vascular growth. Treatment only for cosmetic reasons.
Vascular Lesion.warning: Includes cherry angiomas, hemangiomas. Common and harmless.

Other/Unknown.action: If uncertain, recommend primary care evaluation
Other/Unknown.warning: Could not be confidently classified. Consider clinical evaluation if symptomatic.
